dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 1696 IH: To amend the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States to extend the tariff preference level on imports of certain cotton and man-made fiber, fabric, apparel, and made-up goods from Bahrain under the United States-Bahrain Free Trade Agreement.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Graham (for herself and Mr. Miller of Florida) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States to extend the tariff preference level on imports of certain cotton and man-made fiber, fabric, apparel, and made-up goods from Bahrain under the United States-Bahrain Free Trade Agreement.

section.header: Extension of tariff preference level on imports of certain cotton and man-made fiber, fabric, apparel, and made-up goods from Bahrain under the United States-Bahrain Free Trade Agreement

subsection.text: U.S. Note 13 to subchapter XIV of chapter 99 of the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking January 1, 2016, through July 31, 2016 and inserting January 1, 2026, through July 31, 2026; and

paragraph.text: in the matter following paragraph (d), by striking July 31, 2016 and inserting July 31, 2026.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply with respect to articles entered, or withdrawn from warehouse for consumption, on or after January 1, 2016.
